types.name: TimeRange
types.description: Range of time in which to run backup.

fields.name: startTime
fields.description: Seconds from midnight at which to start.

fields.name: stopTime
fields.description: Seconds from midnight at which to stop.

fields.name: defineStore
fields.description: Define a new store with the given configuration.

fields.name: updateStore
fields.description: Update the saved store configuration.

fields.name: deleteStore
fields.description: Delete the named store, returning its current configuration.

fields.name: defineDataset
fields.description: Define a new dataset with the given configuration.

fields.name: updateDataset
fields.description: Update an existing dataset with the given configuration.

fields.name: deleteDataset
fields.description: Delete the named dataset, returning its current configuration.

types.name: TreeReference
types.description: Reference for a tree entry, such as a file or tree.

types.name: Dataset
types.description: Location, schedule, and pack store for a backup data set.

fields.name: key
fields.description: Identifier for this dataset.

fields.name: computerId
fields.description: Unique computer identifier.

fields.name: basepath
fields.description: Path that is being backed up.

fields.name: schedules
fields.description: Set of schedules that apply to this dataset.

fields.name: latestSnapshot
fields.description: Most recent snapshot for this dataset, if any.

fields.name: packSize
fields.description: Preferred byte length of pack files.

fields.name: stores
fields.description: Identifiers of stores used for saving packs.

types.name: Checksum
types.description: A SHA1 or SHA256 checksum, with algorithm prefix.

types.name: DayOfWeek
types.description: The day of the week, for weekly and monthly schedules.

types.name: Frequency
types.description: How often should the backup run for the dataset.

enumValues.name: HOURLY
enumValues.description: Run every hour.

enumValues.name: DAILY
enumValues.description: Run every day, with optional time range.

enumValues.name: WEEKLY
enumValues.description: Run every week, with optional day-of-week and time range.

enumValues.name: MONTHLY
enumValues.description: Run every month, with optional day-of-month and time range.

inputFields.name: key
inputFields.description: Identifier of dataset to update, null if creating.

inputFields.name: basepath
inputFields.description: Path that is being backed up.

inputFields.name: schedules
inputFields.description: List of schedules to apply to this dataset.

inputFields.name: packSize
inputFields.description: Desired byte length of pack files.

inputFields.name: stores
inputFields.description: Identifiers of stores used for saving packs.

fields.name: configuration
fields.description: Retrieve the configuration record.

fields.name: datasets
fields.description: Find all dataset configurations.

fields.name: dataset
fields.description: Retrieve a specific dataset configuration.

fields.name: stores
fields.description: Find all named store configurations.

fields.name: store
fields.description: Retrieve the named store configuration.

fields.name: snapshot
fields.description: Retrieve a specific snapshot.

fields.name: tree
fields.description: Retrieve a specific tree.

inputFields.name: startTime
inputFields.description: Seconds from midnight at which to start.

inputFields.name: stopTime
inputFields.description: Seconds from midnight at which to stop.

types.name: Store
types.description: Local or remote store for pack files.

fields.name: key
fields.description: Identifier of this store.

fields.name: label
fields.description: User-defined label for this store configuration.

fields.name: kind
fields.description: The type, or kind, of the store (e.g. "local", "minio", "sftp").

fields.name: options
fields.description: Base64 encoded JSON of store options.

types.name: InputSchedule
types.description:
New schedule for the dataset. Combine elements to get backups to run on a
certain day of the week, month, and/or within a given time range.

inputFields.name: frequency
inputFields.description: How often to run the backup.

inputFields.name: timeRange
inputFields.description: Range of time during the day in which to run backup.

inputFields.name: weekOfMonth
inputFields.description: Which week within the month to run the backup.

inputFields.name: dayOfWeek
inputFields.description: Which day of the week to run the backup.

inputFields.name: dayOfMonth
inputFields.description: The day of the month to run the backup.

types.name: Schedule
types.description: A schedule for when to run the backup.

fields.name: frequency
fields.description:
How often the backup will be run. Combines with other elements to
control exactly when the backup is performed.

fields.name: timeRange
fields.description:
Time within the day when the backup will be run. The start time will
come before the stop time if the range spans midnight.

fields.name: weekOfMonth
fields.description: Which week, in combination with the day of the week, to run the backup.

fields.name: dayOfWeek
fields.description:
Day of the week on which to run the backup, for schedules with a weekly
or monthly frequency.

fields.name: dayOfMonth
fields.description:
Day of the month, instead of a week and weekday, to run the backup, for
schedules with a monthly frequency.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description:
GraphQL type kind

The GraphQL specification defines a number of type kinds - the meta type of a type.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description:
## Scalar types

Scalar types appear as the leaf nodes of GraphQL queries. Strings, numbers, and booleans are the built in types, and while it's possible to define your own, it's relatively uncommon.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description:
## Object types

The most common type to be implemented by users. Objects have fields and can implement interfaces.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description:
## Interface types

Interface types are used to represent overlapping fields between multiple types, and can be queried for their concrete type.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description:
## Union types

Unions are similar to interfaces but can not contain any fields on their own.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description:
## Enum types

Like scalars, enum types appear as the leaf nodes of GraphQL queries.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description:
## Input objects

Represents complex values provided in queries _into_ the system.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description:
## List types

Represent lists of other types. This library provides implementations for vectors and slices, but other Rust types can be extended to serve as GraphQL lists.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description:
## Non-null types

In GraphQL, nullable types are the default. By putting a `!` after a type, it becomes non-nullable.

types.name: BigInt
types.description: An integer type larger than the standard signed 32-bit.

types.name: Configuration
types.description: Contains the configuration of the application, pertaining to all datasets.

fields.name: hostname
fields.description: Name of the computer on which this application is running.

fields.name: username
fields.description: Name of the user running this application.

fields.name: computerId
fields.description: Computer UUID for generating bucket names.

types.name: WeekOfMonth
types.description: In combination with DayOfWeek, selects the particular week.

enumValues.name: FIRST
enumValues.description: First such weekday of the month.

enumValues.name: SECOND
enumValues.description: Second such weekday of the month.

enumValues.name: THIRD
enumValues.description: Third such weekday of the month.

enumValues.name: FOURTH
enumValues.description: Fourth such weekday of the month.

enumValues.name: FIFTH
enumValues.description: Fifth such weekday of the month.

types.name: TreeEntry
types.description: A file, directory, or symbolic link within a tree.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the file, directory, or symbolic link.

fields.name: fstype
fields.description: Basic type of the entry, e.g. file or directory.

fields.name: modTime
fields.description: Modification time of the entry.

fields.name: reference
fields.description: Reference to the entry itself.

types.name: Snapshot
types.description: A single backup, either in progress or completed.

fields.name: checksum
fields.description: Computed checksum of the snapshot.

fields.name: parent
fields.description: The snapshot before this one, if any.

fields.name: startTime
fields.description: Time when the snapshot was first created.

fields.name: endTime
fields.description: Time when the snapshot completely finished.

fields.name: fileCount
fields.description: Total number of files contained in this snapshot.

fields.name: tree
fields.description: Reference to the tree containing all of the files.

types.name: EntryType
types.description: Tree entry type, such as a file or directory.

enumValues.name: FILE
enumValues.description: Anything that is not a directory or symlink.

enumValues.name: DIR
enumValues.description: Represents a directory.

enumValues.name: LINK
enumValues.description: Represents a symbolic link.

enumValues.name: ERROR
enumValues.description: Error occurred while processing the entry.

types.name: Tree
types.description: A set of file system entries, such as files, directories, symbolic links.

fields.name: entries
fields.description: Set of entries making up this tree.
